Class Tiles

java.lang.Object
Tiles
public class Tiles extends Object
The Tiles class represents all the tiles used in the map layouts, it is responsible for giving property of the special tiles including hazard tiles (water and fire), force tiles, and exit tiles. It is the one used by the Controller class (isWalkable) and Maps class to simulate the game and its objectives. This class also handles the action of the force tiles when chip has stepped upon them, pushing him into the direction where the force tile has ended or an obstacle/hazard is the next tile. This class works with the Chip class, Inventory class, Maps class, Doors class as it handles the movement and interaction and collision of chip to special and blank tiles

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final char
    BLANK
    Blank tile where an empty space lies and chip can step on anytime
    static final char
    EXIT
    Exit tile where chip can only enter if he has collected all the required chips inside the map
    static final char
    FIRE
    Fire tile and chip can only step on them if he has a fire boots object in the inventory
    static final char
    FORCE_DOWN
    Force tile downwards, moving chip to the direction down or 'S'
    static final char
    FORCE_LEFT
    Force tile left, moving chip to the direction left or 'A'
    static final char
    FORCE_RIGHT
    Force tile right, moving chip to the direction right or 'D'
    static final char
    FORCE_UP
    Force tile upwards, moving chip to the direction up or 'W'
    static final char
    WALL
    Wall tile where chip cannot pass on through, can also be used for setting map boundary
    static final char
    WATER
    Water tile and chip can only step on them if he has a flipper object in the inventory

    • getType

    • isWalkable

      public static boolean isWalkable(char tile, Inventory inv, int requiredChips)
      Has conditions if hazard tile has been stepped on, requires flippers/fire boots, enables collision on walls, logic for exit tile (chips) and rest of types is walkable
      Parameters:
      tile - - specific type of tile that method accepts
      inv - - current inventory of player
      requiredChips - - required chips of current map
      Returns:
      true if satisfied inventory conditions / not wall, false if conditions hasn't been met

    • isForceTile

      public static boolean isForceTile(char tile)
      Determines if tile is a force tile
      Parameters:
      tile - - accepts tile
      Returns:
      true - if tile parameter is a force tile, false - if not a force tile

    • isCollectible

      public static boolean isCollectible(char tile)
      Determines if the tile is a collectible
      Parameters:
      tile - - accepts tile
      Returns:
      true if tile is chip/key/fireboots/flippers, false if tile is not a collectible

    • getForceDirection

      public static char getForceDirection(char tile)
      Gets the direction of the force tile
      Parameters:
      tile - - accepts tile
      Returns:
      FORCE_UP if tile is a FORCE_UP, FORCE_DOWN if tile is a FORCE_DOWN, FORCE_LEFT if tile is a FORCE_LEFT, FORCE_RIGHT if tile is a FORCE_RIGHT, '' if tile is not a force tile

    • applyForce

      public static void applyForce(Chip chip, Maps map)
      Method for force tiles, applies force depending on the direction of the force tile and places chip where force tiles end or if next tile is a wall or hazard. This method also allows the collection of items when the force tile puts chip into their tile.
      Parameters:
      chip - - accepts chip and current position of chip
      map - - accepts map layout and used to determine where to place chip
